reporting-org.narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre

title.narrative: Providing and distributing food and non-food items to Saada governorate (Phase II)

description.narrative: Enabling conflict-affected families and the most vulnerable families to obtain food assistance, shelter aid and non-food items in Saada governorate and the displaced in each of the governorates (Al-Jawf, Marib, Hadramout, Hajjah) and the adjacent areas of Saada (Hajjah). Partial goal: Providing food for (6,000) Yemeni families, (36,000) beneficiaries per month for a period of nine months, in the affected areas for families experiencing displacement in Saada governorate and the displaced people of Saada in the governorates of (Al-Jawf, Marib, Hadr Mut, Hajjah) and providing a decent life for the Yemeni citizen Without being at risk of starvation, to increase the impact of the assistance provided by the center. Providing shelter and non-food items for (6000) families, (36,000) beneficiaries in the shelter and non-food items sector.

Providing food baskets, shelter materials and non-food items from inside the Kingdom and transferring them to the implementing partner's warehouses in the Yemeni interior for the benefit of the most affected families in the districts of Saada governorate and the Saada displaced people in (Al-Jouf, Marib, Hadhramaut, Hajjah) and the adjacent areas of Saada (Hajjah).

• Ensuring access to food and shelter for the most affected groups and working to prevent families from being exposed to hunger. Providing (30,000) food parcels, (1500) tents, (3,000) blankets, and (6,000) shelter bags for a number of districts in Saada Governorate and for Saada displaced people in (Al-Jawf, Marib, Hadhramaut, Hajjah) and adjacent areas to Saada (Hajjah). • Providing food security every month for a period of nine months for (6,000) families, in a way that guarantees meeting their food needs. Achieve food security for (36,000) beneficiaries. Distributing (1,500) tents, (3,000) blankets, and (6,000) shelter bags. • 6,000 families received shelter aid and non-food items. • Access to (36,000) beneficiaries of housing assistance and non-housing materials.

participating-org.narrative: King Salman Humanitarian Aid and Relief Centre
